A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Incredibly disappointing.  

The film either ignores or slams shut much of the interesting potential from Force Awakens while providing mostly tensionless action and irrelevant subplots.  The pacing is incredibly awkward; the movie feels like it lasts about half an hour longer than it should.  The ultimate effect is to feel tired and worn out leaving the theater.  I had never associated tedium with Star Wars before.  

It is a real shame because so many images and performances are so good\, but the script and editing are just beyond hope.  I really wish I could have seen the movie the critics apparently got to\, since it sounds like quite a good time.

Sadly\, what I saw ends up better than Attack of the Clones\, but only by a hair's breadth.  Phantom Menace and (especially) Revenge of the Sith are playing an entirely different ball game.
